If it is a bug report:

- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
## Steps to reproduce
1. Install the MSI  https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/0.6.0.4602/artifacts
2. launch the newly installed powershel
3. run the following

```
Get-ExecutionPolicy
ipmo psreadline
```
## Expected behavior

psreadline should be imported 
## Actual behavior

```
Restricted

PS > ipmo psreadline
ipmo : File C:\program files\powershell\6.0.0.7\Modules\psreadline\PSReadLine.psm1 cannot be loaded because running
scripts is disabled on this system. For more information, see about_Execution_Policies at
http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=135170.
At line:1 char:1
+ ipmo psreadline
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : SecurityError: (:) [Import-Module], PSSecurityException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : UnauthorizedAccess,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand
```
## Environment data

Also, repro's on Nano, where several BVTs are failing.

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable

WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
PSEdition                      Core
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
```

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
changing `powershellproperties.json` in the install location to have this content resolves the issue:

```
{"DisablePromptToUpdateHelp":true,
"Microsoft.PowerShell:ExecutionPolicy":"RemoteSigned"}
```

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
Maybe use `RemoteSigned` as the default, @LeeHolmes @mirichmo ?
It's the default in Server 2012 R2. 
`Restricted` makes sense as the default for the **inbox** version (people may don't want to use PS at all, but it's come with the system).
The act of installation **implies** intention to use PS.
`RemoteSigned` is the most restrictive policy that will allow PSReadLine work out-of-the box.
